data.title: German producer Bernd Eichinger dies
data.meta_description:
German movie producer, director and screenplay writer Bernd Eichinger, who produced The Neverending Story (1984) and Downfall (2004), has died at the age of 61.
Film production firm Constantin Film AG said in a statement that Mr Eichinger suffered a...
data.text:
German movie producer, director and screenplay writer Bernd Eichinger, who produced The Neverending Story (1984) and Downfall (2004), has died at the age of 61.

Film production firm Constantin Film AG said in a statement that Mr Eichinger suffered a deadly heart attack on Monday night during a dinner with family and friends in Los Angeles. One of Mr Eichinger’s recent successful productions was Downfall, for which he also wrote the screenplay.

The movie depicts the last days of Nazi Germany in Adolf Hitler’s bunker and was nominated for an Academy Award in 2005.

Mr Eichinger was a major Constantin shareholder and one of the firm’s leading executives.

He also produced The Name of the Rose (1986) and The House of the Spirits (1993).
